content.description:
Ovid finds solace in exile.

1 Fertur et abducta LyrnesideLyrnesis, -idis, f.: the Lyrnesian woman Briseis tristis Achilles

HaemoniaHaemonius, -a, -um: of or belonging to Thessaly curas attenuasseattenuo, -are: lessen, lighten lyra.

Cum traheret silvas Orpheus et dura canendo

saxa, bis amissa coniuge maestus erat.

5 Me quoque Musa levatlevo, -are: make lighter, relieve Ponti loca iussa petentem:

sola comes nostrae perstititpersto, perstare, perstiti: stand fast, remain throughout + dat. illa fugae;

sola nec insidias, nec SintiSintus, -i, m.: a people of Macedonia militis ensem,

nec mare nec ventos barbariamque timet.
content.question: What Roman ruler sent Ovid to seek the locales of Pontus (line 5) ?
